reasons_to_visit.details: March brings milder temperatures (average highs 16-18°C) and more sunshine, making it ideal for exploring archaeological sites and wandering the city comfortably before summer heat.
See Athens surrounded by greenery as hills like Lycabettus and Philopappou come alive. Wildflowers, including poppies and chamomile, start to appear, especially on archaeological sites.
Enjoy major attractions like the Acropolis and museums with significantly fewer crowds than peak season. Accommodation prices are generally more moderate (outside potential Carnival/Easter periods).
Witness patriotic celebrations, including a large military parade in central Athens and student parades, offering a unique cultural experience.
Depending on the Orthodox calendar, the vibrant Carnival season often culminates in early March, ending with Clean Monday ('Kathara Deftera') festivities like kite flying and Lenten picnics.
The comfortable temperatures are perfect for hiking Athens' hills (Lycabettus, Philopappou, Hymettus) or taking day trips to nearby nature spots.

reasons_to_reconsider.details: March weather is notoriously unpredictable ('Martis gdartis' - March the flayer, as Greeks say). Expect potential for rain, wind, and sudden cool spells alongside sunny days. Pack layers.
Evenings remain cool (average lows 7-9°C), requiring a jacket or warm sweater.
If Carnival's final days or Clean Monday fall in March, expect crowds for events, potential transport disruptions, and closures on Clean Monday (public holiday).
Independence Day (March 25th) is a major public holiday. Expect widespread closures of shops, museums, and archaeological sites. The parade causes significant road closures in the center.
Spring blooms mean rising pollen counts, potentially affecting allergy sufferers.

weather.precipitation: Moderate chance of rain persists, but sunny intervals increase significantly. Can be windy.
weather.general_tips: Pack layers: t-shirts, long sleeves, sweaters, a waterproof and wind-resistant jacket. Comfortable walking shoes essential. Umbrella useful.

tourism_level.crowds: Low to Moderate. Starts picking up slightly from winter lows. Very busy if peak Carnival/Clean Monday falls here.
tourism_level.pricing: Good shoulder season value, unless coinciding with Carnival peak.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Transition from winter calm to spring vibrancy. Can be lively and festive if Carnival culminates early March.

events_holidays.name: Carnival ('Apokries') Peak & Clean Monday ('Kathara Deftera')
events_holidays.description: If occurring, expect peak Carnival festivities (parades e.g., Moschato, Plaka events) leading up to Clean Monday, the first day of Lent, celebrated with kite flying (esp. Philopappou Hill) and Lenten picnics.
events_holidays.notes: Clean Monday is a public holiday - expect closures. Huge crowds on Philopappou Hill for kite flying.

unique_experiences.description: Join Athenians (if Clean Monday falls here) in the tradition of flying kites and enjoying Lenten foods (seafood, taramasalata, lagana bread) outdoors.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Philopappou Hill gets extremely crowded. Go early. Bring your own kite or buy one there. It's a festive, family atmosphere.

unique_experiences.description: Visit the iconic site as spring arrives, enjoying greener slopes and fewer crowds than peak season. Wildflowers may start appearing.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check opening hours. Wear layers and comfortable shoes. Go early or late afternoon.

unique_experiences.activity: Visit the Museum of Cycladic Art
unique_experiences.description: Explore the fascinating collection of ancient Cycladic figurines and Greek art in an elegant setting. Good indoor option.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check opening hours. Can be combined with exploring Kolonaki.

unique_experiences.description: Enjoy a peaceful walk as the garden starts showing signs of spring blooms. A relaxing escape in the city center.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Free entry. Good spot for a break. Check out the resident turtles in the ponds.

weather.precipitation: Rain becomes less likely, sunny days more dominant. Feels distinctly spring-like, though cool spells are still possible.
weather.general_tips: Continue layering. Sunscreen becomes more important on sunny days. Comfortable walking shoes remain key.

tourism_level.crowds: Moderate and steadily increasing towards April. Can be very busy around March 25th due to parade/holiday.
tourism_level.pricing: Shoulder season rates, but watch for potential increases around Independence Day weekend.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Pleasant spring atmosphere. Mix of local life and increasing tourism. Patriotic feel around March 25th.

events_holidays.name: Greek Independence Day (National Holiday)
events_holidays.description: Commemorates the start of the War of Independence against the Ottoman Empire in 1821. Features a large military parade on major avenues (e.g., Vasilissis Sofias) and student parades.
events_holidays.notes: Major public holiday. Widespread closures (sites, museums, shops). Significant road closures in city center due to parade. Patriotic atmosphere.

unique_experiences.where: Central Athens (route varies slightly year to year, typically near Syntagma)
unique_experiences.description: Experience the patriotic fervor and pageantry of the military and student parades on March 25th.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Arrive very early to secure a viewing spot. Be prepared for huge crowds and extensive security/road closures. Check the parade route beforehand.

unique_experiences.description: Take advantage of pleasant spring weather to walk (or take the funicular) up Lycabettus Hill for panoramic views of Athens, the Acropolis, and the sea.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Wear comfortable shoes for the walk. Sunset views are spectacular. Chapel and cafe at the top.
unique_experiences.best_time: Afternoon / Sunset on a clear day

unique_experiences.description: Visit the heart of ancient Athens, including the well-preserved Temple of Hephaestus and the Stoa of Attalos museum, enjoying comfortable walking temperatures.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Combined ticket with Acropolis available. Allow 1.5-2 hours.

unique_experiences.activity: Visit the Benaki Museum of Greek Culture
unique_experiences.description: Explore the rich collection spanning Greek history from prehistory to the 20th century. A great indoor option if weather turns.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check opening hours. Closed on March 25th.
